page.title: 15BIOGRAPHY _LOCAL PERSONALITY
page.content: Mrs Tulip is not a public figure in the broadest sense, but is well known & respected in Newfield, where she was born 83yrs ago. It was in her small, neat terraced home (street in slide 3) that she talked about her life and the changes she has seen within the local community. This brought an interesting new facet to some of the younger views previously recorded in these pages. Mrs Tulip comes of mining stock, her father and husband both miners. In her youth several local collieries were in operation & full employment taken for granted, though some men lost their jobs during the General Strike of1926. She paralleled the present attempts of the Nottingham miners to form their own union, when men were sent from the pit at Byers Green to work at Newfield forcing the local men to protect their own jobs by similar action-it failed.
